contentrichtext.text: {{about|the species from the Americas|the species from Asia and Oceania|Ruddy-breasted Crake}} {{Taxobox | name = Ruddy Crake | image = PorzanaRubraSmit.jpg | status = LC | status_system = IUCN3.1 | status_ref = <ref>{{IUCN|id=106002838 |title=''Laterallus ruber'' |assessors=[[BirdLife International]] |version=2012.1 |year=2012 |accessdate=16 July 2012}}</ref> | image = | regnum = [[Animal]]ia | phylum = [[Chordate|Chordata]] | classis = [[Aves]] | ordo = [[Gruiformes]] | familia = [[Rallidae]] | genus = ''[[Laterallus]]'' | species = '''''L. ruber''''' | binomial = ''Laterallus ruber'' | binomial_authority = ([[Philip Sclater|Sclater]] & [[Osbert Salvin|Salvin]], 1860) }} The '''Ruddy Crake''' (''Laterallus ruber'') is a [[bird]] in the rail family, [[Rallidae]]. It is a small crake, 14-16.5 cm in length. It is mostly bright chestnut in colour with a paler chin and belly, blackish crown and dark grey ear-coverts. The [[beak|bill]] is black, the [[iris (anatomy)|iris]] is red and the legs and feet are olive-green. The bird occurs from [[Mexico]] south to north-west [[Costa Rica]]. It is found in freshwater habitats such as marshes, [[reedbed]]s, damp fields and ditches. == References == {{reflist}} *Taylor, Barry & Ber van Perlo (1998) ''Rails: A Guide to the Rails, Crakes, Gallinules and Coots of the World'', Pica Press, Sussex.
